problem_text: [BG] Books contain tons of knowledge. [BG] When a person reads a book, that person gains knowledge. [BG] If a person gains knowledge, they become smarter. Harry read the book “Walden” by Henry Thoreau.
predicates:
Book(x) ::: x is a book.
Knowledge(x) ::: x is knowledge.
Contains(x, y) ::: x contains y.
Person(x) ::: x is a person.
Reads(x, y) ::: x reads y.
Gains(x, y) ::: x gains y.
Smarter(x) ::: x becomes smarter.
Author(x, y) ::: x is the author of y.
Title(x, y) ::: x has the title y.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Henry Thoreau is a person who gains knowledge from the book "Walden".
tests.conclusions: ∃x ∃y ∃z (Person(x) ∧ Author(x, y) ∧ Title(y, "Walden") ∧ Gains(z, Knowledge(y)) ∧ Person(z)) ::: Henry Thoreau is a person who gains knowledge from the book "Walden". FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry reads a book, then Harry becomes smarter.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If a book contains knowledge and a person reads that book, then that person becomes smarter.
tests.conclusions: ∀x ∀y (Book(x) ∧ Contains(x, y) ∧ Person(z) ∧ Reads(z, x) → Smarter(z)) ::: If a book contains knowledge and a person reads that book, then that person becomes smarter. TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry reads the book "Walden" and "Walden" contains knowledge, then Harry becomes smarter.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry reads the book "Walden" and "Walden" has the title "Walden", then Harry becomes smarter.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry reads a book, then that book contains knowledge.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry reads a book that has the title "Walden", then Harry becomes smarter.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Henry Thoreau is the author of the book "Walden" and Harry reads "Walden", then Harry becomes smarter.
tests.conclusions: Author(henry Thoreau, walden) ∧ Reads(harry, walden) → Smarter(harry) ::: TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Henry Thoreau authored a book and that book contains knowledge, then Henry Thoreau becomes smarter.
tests.conclusions: (∃x (Author(henry Thoreau, x) ∧ Book(x) ∧ Contains(x, knowledge))) → Smarter(henry Thoreau) ::: FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Harry reads "Walden" and "Walden" contains knowledge, does Harry gain knowledge?
tests.conclusions: ∃x ∃y (Person(x) ∧ Book(y) ∧ Title(y, "Walden") ∧ Reads(x, y) ∧ Contains(y, Knowledge(y))) → Gains(harry, Knowledge(walden)) ::: TRUE

candidate_solutions.text:
# Predicates:
Book(x) ::: x is a book.
Knowledge(x) ::: x is knowledge.
Contains(x, y) ::: x contains y.
Person(x) ::: x is a person.
Reads(x, y) ::: x reads y.
Gains(x, y) ::: x gains y.
Smarter(x) ::: x becomes smarter.
Author(x, y) ::: x is the author of y.
Title(x, y) ::: x has the title y.

# Premises:
∀x (Book(x) → ∃y (Knowledge(y) ∧ Contains(x, y))) ::: Books contain tons of knowledge.
∀x ∀y (Person(x) ∧ Reads(x, y) → Gains(x, Knowledge(y))) ::: When a person reads a book, that person gains knowledge.
∀x (Gains(x, Knowledge(x)) → Smarter(x)) ::: If a person gains knowledge, they become smarter.
Person(harry) ∧ Book(walden) ∧ Author(henrythoreau, walden) ∧ Title(walden, "Walden") ∧ Reads(harry, walden) ::: Harry read the book “Walden” by Henry Thoreau.

validation.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or uncertain? Walden contains knowledge.
validation.conclusions: Contains(walden, knowledge) ::: Walden contains knowledge. true
